page.title: 09Easton Village Life
page.content:
There used to be{2 shops}in the village, one on the corner of Marlingford Rd, where household accessories could be bought and the other was on the corner of Dog lane, selling sweets, flour and sugar etc. This shop was situated in the family's living room. Now in Easton there is only one shop,{'The Post Office'}which has changed hands many times, but is now like a{small supermarket.
In early days the village had only {one petrol pump;}now there is a large garage owned by Mr. Gooch.
In the early 19th century, the village folk had to walk to the water pump to get water, but now{every house {has water direct from the mains {supply.}The water pump is now the site for the{village sign.
